text: Ramilya Munavarovna Burangulova (, born July 11, 1961) is a Russian marathon runner. She was born in Kandry-Kutuy, Bashkir Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic. ==Achievements== *All results regarding marathon, unless stated otherwise {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |8th |2:33:00 |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |8th |2:38:46 |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |4th |2:33:03 |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |25th |2:41.15 |- |rowspan=2|1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |35th |2:38:04 |- |Honolulu Marathon |Honolulu, Hawaii |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:34:28 |- |2000 |Dubai Marathon |Dubai, United Arab Emirates |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:40:22 |- |2001 |Dubai Marathon |Dubai, United Arab Emirates |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:37:07 |- |2004 |Baltimore Marathon |Baltimore, United States |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:40:21 |- |2005 |Baltimore Marathon |Baltimore, United States |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:42:00 |- |2007 |Los Angeles Marathon |Los Angeles, United States |bgcolor=gold|1st |2:37:54 |} ===Personal bests=== *5000 metres - 16:00.66 min (1995) *Half marathon - 1:10:14 hrs *Marathon - 2:28:03 hrs (1993) ==External links== * Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Russian female long- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of the Unified Team Category:Olympic athletes of Russia Category:Russian female marathon runners
title: Ramilya Burangulova
